content: Ex-Bush admin official: Many at Gitmo are innocent SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico — Many detainees locked up at Guantanamo were innocent men swept up by U.S. forces unable to distinguish enemies from noncombatants, a former Bush administration official said Thursday. "There are still innocent people there," Lawrence B. Wilkerson, a Republican who was chief of staff to then-Secretary of State Colin Powell, told The Associated Press. "Some have been there six or seven years." Full article at ... >http://www3.signonsandiego.com/stories/2009/mar/19/cb-guantanamo-wrongly-held-031909/?zIndex=69669
reply: Ex-Bush admin official: Many at Gitmo are innocent SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico — Many detainees locked up at Guantanamo were innocent men swept up by U.S. forces unable to distinguish enemies from noncombatants, a former Bush administration official said Thursday. content: Any idiot could have seen this probability....They just rounded up anyone to show America that "hey, look, we're catching the bad guys.." Typical Police tactics....

content: most of the innocents have already been released. if the dems would not have got in the way then they probably would have got their military hearings and been released earlier. of course there were people who were caught up in the sweeps in a-stan and iraq that didnt belong in prison. like i said the last 250 in gitmo are not good guys.

title: Ex-Bush admin official: Many at Gitmo are innocent

content: "Wilkerson, who flew combat missions as a helicopter pilot in Vietnam and left the government in January 2005, said he did not speak out while in government because some of the information was classified. He said he feels compelled to do so now because Cheney has claimed in recent press interviews that President Barack Obama is making the U.S. less safe by ordering Guantanamo closed and reversing other Bush administration policies." Give me a break! This is a crock. Some of these so called innocent people have already been released only to return to the terrorist cause.
reply: "Wilkerson, who flew combat missions as a helicopter pilot in Vietnam and left the government in January 2005, said he did not speak out while in government because some of the information was classified. content: The way the Bush Administration handled detainees in Afghanistan is like how they conducted every aspect of the nation's business: it was a grotesque failure that could appear to a neutral observer to have as its object to actually damage the position of the United States in the world. Walt
